content: tps into a tss stitch and vice versa 1 remaining repeat row 2 and 3 until the project is square i suggest 23 row for dishcloth 44 row for napkin 2 end by working a return pass 1 st remains on hook dishcloth optional hanging loop chain 8 attach via slip_stitch into the 1st vertical bar on the top right only corner of the dishcloth the vertical bar you usually skip cast off by working a slip_stitch into each vertical bar across slip_stitch into the tfs under both loops as usual cut the yarn pull through and weave in the ends edging suggested for napkin round 1 switch to regular crochet hook working into each vertical bar inserting hook from right to left as you have been doing single_crochet across work 3 single_crochet into the tfs rotate work napkin only 90 degrees and single_crochet into every stitch down the left edge working under both loops of the edge chain work 3 single_crochet into the bottom corner and continue in the same manner along the bottom and right side join with slip_stitch to the 1st single_crochet of the round cut yarn and weave in ends the video shows you how to work under the 2 loops of the chain of vs along the edges of the bottom and sides of the napkin to keep the edge tidy block the napkin into a perfect square re-shape and lie flat to dry after each machine wash 4 | p age crochet pattern loveapplecrafts com 1 when working honeycomb st stitches that were worked as tps in the previous row can be recognized by the purl bump at the base of the vertical bar it looks like a loop of scarf in front of the neck tss stitches look like the scarf is wrapped behind the neck always work a tss into a tps stitch and vice versa once you can recognize tss versus tps stitches you always know how to start each row so you don t have to keep track of whether you are on row 3 or 4 of the pattern above it also helps avoid mistakes 2 the easiest way to count row is to count the return pass chains you can see running through the work behind the honeycombs the very last return pass chain at the top of the work counts as a row the foundation chain along the bottom edge does not nor does the chain at the top created if you worked a slip_stitch cast-off 5 | p age
